goal.core.runtime.service.environmentport

Class EnvironmentPort

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.core.runtime.service.environmentport.EnvironmentPort

  • public class EnvironmentPort
extends java.lang.Object
    Tool to handle the connection with an LocalMessagingEnvironment. It runs on the client side and communicates with a LocalMessagingEnvironment which runs on another computer.

    Basic functionality is to track the run state of the EnvMsgConnector.

    This also handles events like newEntity and passes them on to the AgentService if necessary.

    Author:
    W.Pasman

    • Constructor Detail

      • EnvironmentPort

        public EnvironmentPort(nl.tudelft.goal.messaging.messagebox.MessageBoxId envMessageBoxId,
               MessagingService messaging)
                throws GOALLaunchFailureException

        Create environment port to control environment.

        The EnvironmentPort must be immediately ready to handle state requests, even if no environment has been connected yet.

        TODO: looks like a round about construction to get environment info in...
        Parameters:
        envMessageBoxId - The message box of the environment that this port should connect to.
        messaging - The messaging service to use.
        Throws:
        GOALLaunchFailureException - If we failed to create a message box

    • Method Detail

      • shutDown

        public void shutDown()
              throws nl.tudelft.goal.messaging.exceptions.MessagingException,
                     eis.exceptions.EnvironmentInterfaceException
        Shut down the environment port. This just removes our connection with the environment, but does not close the remote environment. A reset command is sent to the remote environment though, in order to support batches of systems/tests properly.
        Throws:
        nl.tudelft.goal.messaging.exceptions.MessagingException
        eis.exceptions.EnvironmentInterfaceException

        public void start()
           throws nl.tudelft.goal.messaging.exceptions.MessagingException,

        requests the environment to start. NOTE: The env may not be running when this call returns.

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws nl.tudelft.goal.messaging.exceptions.MessagingException,
                  eis.exceptions.EnvironmentInterfaceException
        Reset the environment. Note, this is a parameterless reset because the EnvMsgConnector remembers the original init parameters and re-uses them. See EnvMsgConnector#reset(). Note2: the env may not yet be reset when this call returns.
        Throws:
        nl.tudelft.goal.messaging.exceptions.MessagingException
        eis.exceptions.EnvironmentInterfaceException
